name: Hari Vinnakota
my_business: We are into production and supply of Organic pasture-raised eggs that represent a premium category of egg production that combines the ethical and environmental standards of organic farming with the welfare-focused practices of pasture-raising hens. These eggs are laid by hens that forage on organic pastures, consuming a diverse diet of grasses, insects, and organic supplemental feed free from synthetic pesticides, GMOs, antibiotics, and hormones. Research consistently shows that these eggs offer a superior nutritional profile compared to conventional eggs from caged hens, including higher levels of essential vitamins, antioxidants, and beneficial fatty acids. Key benefits include improved heart health, enhanced brain function, and better eye protection, alongside advantages like richer flavor, animal welfare, and sustainable farming.

my_favourite_bni_story: Attending the BNI Awards Night was a truly memorable experience. I had the opportunity to provide makeup services for several chapter members and was grateful for the recognition that followed. What made the evening particularly special was being approached by the Regional Director for Hyderabad Sanjana Shah, who expressed her appreciation for my work and later engaged me for her personal makeup requirements. This connection extended further, allowing me the privilege of working with her family members, including her late mother—a deeply meaningful experience. What stands out to me most is how BNI fosters such unexpected yet impactful opportunities, where recognition and referrals can come from the most surprising places.
